data:
Generate a story and a title for the story you generate and put the title at the first row. The story should involves the following entities and original example. Please make sure the story you generate is at least 500 words long.
Original example: Emma Reynolds  The tony guard-gated neighborhood of Hidden Hills in Los Angeles is known for its scores of celebrities, athletes, musicians and influencers. Not your typical stark-white, jewel-box-like LA house, this contemporary abode was designed with unique character, exquisite materials and impeccable craftsmanship. “The contemporary kitchen, perfect for relaxed entertaining, seamlessly flows into the outdoor patio complete with a cozy fireplace, where you can enjoy stunning views of the 65-foot pool. The heart of the property is its great room with double-height vaulted ceilings, panoramic windows and direct backyard access, as well as sleek Pietra marble flooring. Head through the great room's the automatic Fleetwood sliding glass pocket doors for immediate access to the backyard, where you'll find an alfresco dining table and a fireplace. Across the pool, there's a luxe cabana with a bevy of amemtities, including a a covered sitting area, a billiards table, a bathroom, a built-in-barbecue and a video wall. The upstairs, meanwhile, is accessed through the staircase in the family room, which has a live Zen garden with a bonsai tree underneath the stairs for a touch of biophilic design . The room's spa-like en suite bathroom has dual chiseled stone vanities, a team shower and a soaking tub, making this the ultimate private retreat.With natural scenery in every direction, you can enjoy your morning coffee in the eat-in kitchen with the warmth of your hearth room wood burning fireplace or an iced tea on the elevated screen porch, taking in the gorgeous lake views, which are spectacular in any season! It has a 48" range, 48" glass front refrigerator, 2.5 ovens, warming drawer, double sinks (each with disposal), all beneath a stunning tin ceiling and encased in custom cabinetry. The walkout includes a private theater, family room (has enough space for pool tables or any other gaming furniture), well-appointed bar covered in the luxurious semi-precious stone - Blue and Gold Flash Labradorite, a mirrored clad exercise room with a view that inspires activity, a unique wine cellar and yet another master bedroom ensuite with granite counters (could serve as an in-law suite) and a separate exit to the outdoor patio completes the inside of the home. The dual entrance aggregate drive showcases the yard filled of mature flowering trees and shrubs splashing color across the seasons (Maple, Crabapple, Red Bud, Burning Bush, Hydrangea, Rhododendron, Roses etc.). It has a professional formal landscape adorned with perennials that extend a riot of color all year long (Stella De Oro Daylilies, Brown-Eyed Susans, Astilbe, Lavendar & Sedum, etc). Situated at the end of a tree-lined boulevard and mere minutes from shopping, dining, parks, and much more, this property provides the discerning buyer convenient access to Bloomington-Normal's amenities. Stunning outdoor living area- an entertainer's dream with a gorgeous enclosed courtyard that flows from the sprawling front porch and offers a deck with pergola, patio and even a natural gas line run for a grill! With beamed ceilings, french doors, refinished hardwood floors, period millwork, double pane windows, built-ins GALORE and all the charm and character one would hope to find in a home of this magnitude!As you drive up to the top of the mountain be ready to be wowed by this beautiful home and the amazing views.Open the door to a spacious living area complete with a beautiful rock fireplace which reaches from floor to ceiling, upon entering the foyer you will see a staircase that leaves to the loft area which overlooks the living room, while in the loft look out at the amazing views from this advantage point. Not to be outshone the large kitchen features one of kind cabinets, granite countertops, spacious setting at the bar while showcasing the dining area. As you start to look around the main level of this gem you find yourself astonished at all the main level offers, a large office space, another sitting area, 2 bedrooms with Jack and Jill bathroom large windows 7 Bedroom Home in Martinsville - $995,000 PRIVACY & SPECTACULAR VIEWS! Gourmet kitchen has granite countertops, upscale stainless steel appliances and is open to the dining area. Features include cathedral ceilings, quartz countertops, inlaid tile designs in kitchen, beautiful breakfast nook, bamboo flooring in bath and spare bedrooms, custom windows provide plenty of natural lighting, beautiful views of your property from the back patio, gorgeous master suite with oak flooring, this home comes with closets everywhere to store your stuff. Owners worked closely with their architect to design a house that looked like traditional Virginia in front & contemporary California in back. Impressive two story family room has soaring 19' ceilings, fireplace, built-ins and 3 levels of windows on back wall. Upscale features include a butler's pantry, cherry cabinet wet bar, front & back staircases, beautiful moldings, rock fireplace.

Begin story:

Hidden Hills Gem: Emma Reynolds' Newly Listed 7-Bedroom Home in California

Robb Report, the premier source for all luxury real estate stories, reported yesterday that Emma Reynolds' newly listed 7-bedroom home, located in the guard-gated neighborhood of Hidden Hills in Los Angeles, is the talk of Hollywood. Emma, who is already well known in the entertainment industry, has luxury home buyers marveling at the generous 6,000 square foot estate.

The tony guard-gated neighborhood is no stranger to celebrities, athletes, musicians, and influencers, and Reynolds' home is no exception. Where other homes show a stark white, jewel-box style featured throughout L.A., Reynolds designed her home with an exquisite eye for detail, using materials and craftsmanship of the highest quality.

The heart of the property is the great room, with its soaring, vaulted ceilings that reach to the skies and its Pietra marble floors that open on to the outdoor patio and pool. The outdoor patio also has a cozy fireplace and 65-foot pool. A luxe cabana sits across the pool and includes an outdoor sitting area, a billiards table, a bathroom, a built-in-barbecue, and a video wall.

The grand entryway opens up to a formal living and dinning room, featuring tall French windows that give way to the screened-in porch. Through the kitchen, a wall of windows looks across the expansive courtyard and out to the property's rolling hills. The kitchen features a 48-inch range, 48-inch glass front refrigerator, 2.5 ovens, warming drawer, and custom cabinetry. The walkout on the lower level features a private theatre, family room (large enough for pool tables or any other gaming furniture), wet bar with luxurious Blue and Gold Flash Labradorite, mirrored-clad exercise room, and a unique wine cellar.

The upstairs includes a master bedroom ensuite with granite counters and an abundance of closet space. For a touch of "biophilic" design, a Zen garden is nestled under the stairs, with a bonsai tree as its centerpiece. The master bedroom's spa-like en suite bathroom includes dual chiseled stone vanities, a steam shower and a soaking tub, making this a very private retreat.

The exterior of the home flows seamlessly into the surrounding beautiful hills and countryside. An entertainer's dream, the exterior area includes an enclosed courtyard, a patio with a pergola, and a natural gas line for the built-in-grill. Throughout the home, features include beamed-ceilings, french doors, refinished hardwood floors, period millwork, double pane windows, and plentiful built-ins.

Williams and Branden Williams, alongside Max Nobel and Rachel Salgado, are well connected agents from Beverly Hills Estates and have been busy showing prospective buyers the home. Buyers from Los Angeles, North Carolina, Southwestern France, Central Illinois and even Australia are coming to take a look at the property.

Rayni and Branden Williams, founding members of the popular All-Star browse, have been receiving inquiries from agents, private buyers, and investors on the home. Rayni, who is originally from North Carolina, is representing the sellers and is making sure the process runs smoothly.

Ben Simmons of the Brooklyn Nets and Greg LaPlant of the NBA recently toured the home while on a trip to Los Angeles. Ben Tweeted out a photo of him and Greg in the living room, recognizing the 7-bedroom's quaintness, "Look at this rare gem the folks at the Newly Listed home in Hidden Hills have.”

The home's spacious backyard features 3 bedroom homes in Southwestern France and a 48-inch range, 48-inch glass front refrigerator, 2.5 ovens, warming drawer, a built-in-grill, and a professional formal landscape adorned with perennials of all shapes and colors. The driveway showcases a yard filled with mature flowering trees and shrubs that splash color throughout the seasons - Maple, Crabapple, Red Bud, Burning Bush, Hydrangea, Rhododendron, and Roses.

The home is merely minutes away from shopping, dining, parks, and other local amenities, but with the PRIVACY & SPECTACULAR VIEWS the house provides, it feels like a world away. Immediately, buyers are impressed by the combination of traditional Virginia style in the front and contemporary California-style in the back, with twin staircase, butler's pantry, cherry cabinet wet bar, beautiful moldings, and rock fireplace. Upscale features include quartz countertops, Inlaid tile designs, Bamboo flooring, and custom windows. 

When asked about the home, the current owners - Patrick and Emma Reynolds - commented, “We worked closely with our architect to design a house that was both beautiful and practical. When we moved here, we knew we had found a rare gem.”

Although the Reynold's are sad to part ways with their home, they are excited to see what is ahead. Emma Reynolds said, “I am sure the new owners will find the home as inviting and relaxing as we have - ultimately allowing them to enjoy the luxury and peacefulness that both Martinsville and the Tri-Valley School District have to offer.”

If you are in the market for a luxury home in the Hidden Hills area, make sure to look up the Reynold's 7-bedroom home. With an arrangement of travel websites, luxury lifestyle magazines, and news outlets already promoting the home, such as Robb Report, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and the Martinsville Bulletin, it won't be around for long. Plus, for a limited time, the sellers are working with Preciosa Lighting and the Michelin Guide and providing huge discounts for any buyer who wishes to purchase the home. 

So, if you are looking for an amazing property in the popular William's and Brook's neighborhood, don't forget to checkout the 7-Bedroom Home in Martinsville. With its pleasing combination of traditional Virginia and contemporary California style, gorgeous views, and spacious exterior - this is a rare gem you don't want to miss.
